At least three people have been killed and nine seriously injured in a clash between farmers and nomads over grazing land in Borno state. Violence erupted on 24 December in Bulabulin Ngaburawa village when herdsmen from the Shuwa tribe reportedly led their herd onto lands belonging to farmers from the Kanuri tribe.
Unidentified assassins kill University Professor
Following vandalism 40 civilians are killed in an oil pipeline explosion.
Two people have been left dead after a bloody clash between over 250 youths and the police in Gwoza local government area of Borno State.

The University of Maiduguri was closed down midway into second semester exams, following rampaging protests by students over alleged "blasphemy". The protest followed allegation that a student had used pages of Quran to clean himself up after excretion.
Five were killed along the Lagos-Abeokuta Expressway with stray gunfire.

Reports of electoral violence in state elections: violence marred the process in Roni, Roni local government of the state as youths from rival political groups engaged in free for all fight. The town was enveloped in smoke as the warring parties made burn-fires on the major streets of the town. In an effort to stop the violence, a policeman was viciously attacked and he had to be rushed to the hospital.

Report that ANPP Governor Ali Modu Sheriffs ECOMOG militia forces are "terrorizing the people of Borno [...] This group (ECOMOG) has been burning private houses and other properties and assets of opponents (real or imagined).
